page.title: 07 Tourism in Ballywalter
page.content: Ballywalter is a little seaside village about 30 km from Belfast. Before the car and package holidays abroad there were six or maybe more hotels in Ballywalter. People felt that 30 km was far enough to travel so they often rented a house for a month in this village. Villagers made a little money by doing bed and breakfast which either poor people went to or rich people who couldn't get a room in any of the hotels. Now there are no hotels at all. If people come to Ballywlater now they just come on day trips. Half of the eastern coast of our block is caravan sites. Farmers who live along the coast own and look after these sites.
